buildup.text: Western individualistic cultures report higher procrastination than collectivist ones.

discovery.text: Social accountability in collectivist cultures creates external pressure that reduces delay.

twist.text: But collectivist cultures report more guilt about procrastination. The delay is less, the shame is more.

climax.text: Culture shapes how, when, and why we procrastinate â€” but no society has eliminated it.

punchline.text: Every culture delays. Only the guilt differs.
